abstract: Report accusing Islamic State of genocide against Iraq’s Yazidi minority is brought to International Criminal Court, but court says it has no jurisdiction over incidents occurring in non-member countries; Yazidi leaders suggest militants who hail from member states could be prosecuted.
lead_paragraph: The court’s current chief prosecutor said because those countries have not joined the court, it has no jurisdiction over matters that take place in Syria or Iraq.

headline.main: Iraq: Yazidis Turn to International Court
headline.print_headline: Middle East; Iraq: Yazidis Turn to International Court

snippet: The court’s current chief prosecutor said because those countries have not joined the court, it has no jurisdiction over matters that take place in Syria or Iraq.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
